title: Searching for axion-like particles with SPHEREx
authors: Marco Regis, Marco Taoso, Jorge Terol Calvo
abstract:
We study prospects to detect axion-like particles (ALPs) with the upcoming
near-infrared telescope SPHEREx. The signal under investigation is the ALP
decay into two photons. Assuming dark matter (DM) to be in the form of ALPs, we
analyze the signal from the DM halos of dwarf spheroidal galaxies, the Large
Magellanic Cloud and the Milky Way. We find that SPHEREx can significantly
improve current limits on the axion-photon coupling in the 0.5-3 eV ALP mass
range.
